wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Colpitts Granger (1802 – 13 August 1852) was a British Radical politician and barrister.Admitted to Inner Temple in 1830, Granger was later elected Radical MP for City of Durham at the 1841 general election and held the seat until his death in 1852.

response: In the BDI golf tournaments of Plymouth, MA under commissioner Joe Corshia, a granger is a type of mulligan where you place your ball at the 150 marker.  This is named in honor of Thomas Granger.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1852 United Kingdom general election

response: *Thomas Granger (1625–1642), first person hanged in the Massachusetts Bay Colony
